alert.note: Alert for Green Lake; Marquette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 14 at 2:07AM CDT until April 14 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions This Afternoon Toward Central Wisconsin... .Upgraded to Red Flag Warning for another round of critical fire weather conditions due to very warm temps, dryness, and breezy winds toward central Wisconsin this afternoon, with elevated fire weather conditions elsewhere. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL WISCONSIN... The National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan has upgraded the Fire Weather Watch and has issued a Red Flag Warning for central Wisconsin, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 8 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Marquette and Green Lake counties. * TIMING...For the Red Flag Warning, from 11 AM until 8 PM CDT Friday evening. * WINDS...South 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 70s to near 80 degrees. * IMPACTS...Caution is advised when using outdoor fires and equipment that causes sparks. Make sure all outdoor fires are extinguished properly, and consult your local DNR office for possible burn bans.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
